title: Scoreboard for streaming protocol â€” verify ordering, duplication & loss
description:
Scenario: Your DUT processes streaming packets that must preserve order and not drop or duplicate packets. Design a scoreboard that compares observed output transactions to expected reference model results and flags ordering, duplication or loss.

Diagram (flow):
  tx_in -> DUT -> tx_out
  Expected sequence: [P0, P1, P2, ...]
  Observed sequence: [P0, P2, P1, ...]  (ordering violation)

examples.output: Scoreboard reports ordering violation at index 1: expected 0x11 but saw 0x12
examples.explanation: Maintain a queue of expected transactions and compare each observed transaction in-order; log mismatches and context.

constraints: Assume a single producer and consumer; timestamps may be used for ordering but be careful with out-of-order delivery due to parallelism.
hints: Keep a reference model (e.g., a simple FIFO) to derive expected outputs.
Record context (cycle, sequence id) when reporting mismatches.
